name: 'The Sopranos': Seasons 1-3 Trivia Quiz | 'Sopranos'- Season Specific | 25 Questions

questions.text: Who killed Richie Aprile?
questions.explanation:
Janice Soprano.

	In episode no. 25, 'The Knight In White Satin Armor,' Richie struck Janice during an argument. Without a word, she walked out of the room, returned with a gun, and fired a round into Richie's chest. He died almost instantly.

questions.text: Tony and Pussy both emptied their guns into Matthew Bevilaqua, one of the young men responsible for the attempted hit on Christopher.
questions.explanation:
True.

	It seemed as though Tony killed him first, but both men unloaded their rounds into the young man.

questions.text: Who did NOT have an active hand in killing Big Pussy?
questions.explanation:
Christopher Moltisanti.

	Christopher did not go along when Tony, Paulie and Silvio took Pussy out on the final boat ride of his life.

questions.text: In episode no. 20, 'D-Girl,' Christopher meets a number of Hollywood figures, all of whom play themselves. Which of the following is not one of them?
questions.explanation:
Quentin Tarantino.

	Tarantino's name is mentioned several times, but he never appears in the episode. Favreau is in town producing a film starring Bernhard and Garofalo.

questions.text: Tony's psychiatrist, Dr. Jennifer Melfi, has a psychiatrist of her own, Dr. Eliot Kupferberg. The actor who plays Kupferberg is also a director. Which of the following films has he directed?
questions.explanation:
'Mask'.

	Peter Bogdanovich, aside from being a noted director and actor, is also a respected film historian.

questions.text: In the second season of the show, Carmela Soprano finds herself tempted into adultery by Vic Musto, a lonely widower. The actor playing the role of Vic once acted on a popular 80's TV series. What was it?
questions.explanation:
'Riptide'.

	Joe Penny starred with Perry King on the seabound detective series 'Riptide,' which ran from 1984-1986 on NBC.

questions.text: Anthony Soprano Jr. -- 'A.J.' for short -- has been shown participating in a number of sports at school. Which is not one of them?
options: He has been shown playing all of these sports
questions.explanation:
Soccer.

	A.J. is on the swim team during the second season, and joins the football team in the third. We've never seen him playing soccer, but his sister Meadow was on the soccer team in high school.

questions.text: For the first two seasons of the show, Tony Soprano had a Russian mistress. What was her name?
questions.explanation:
Irina.

	Tony broke it off with Irina (played by the lovely Oskana Babiy) at the end of the second season. Svetlana -- with whom Tony had a brief sexual encounter in the *fourth* season -- is her cousin.

questions.text: What's the name of Tony's boat?
questions.explanation:
The Stugots.

	'Stugots' is an Italian word for a certain part (well, parts) of the male reproductive anatomy that we will not discuss in this venue. =)

questions.text: The Sopranos have a maid. What is her nationality?
questions.explanation:
Polish.

	Mentioned whenever Tony is displeased with her service for any reason -- he never passes up a chance to make an ethnic slur.

questions.text: In episode no. 30, Dr. Melfi becomes the victim of a brutal rapist. Where does this man work?
questions.explanation:
A restaurant.

	Melfi happens upon his picture -- and his name -- in an 'employee of the month' display at a restaurant she frequents.

questions.text: Which of the following men has NOT had sex with Meadow Soprano?
questions.explanation:
Vincent.

	As far as we know, as of the end of the third season Meadow has only been with two men -- her college boyfriend Noah, and Jackie Aprile, Jr. 'Vincent' I made up.

questions.text: In episode no. 21, 'Full Leather Jacket,' Christopher Moltisanti is shot several times. What surgical procedure does he later require, as a result of his injuries?
questions.explanation:
a splenectomy.

	Chris' spleen was damaged beyond repair, and had to be removed. As he says to Tony after recovering, 'I got no spleen, Gene!'

questions.text: Several of the actors from 'The Sopranos' have careers in music as well. Three of the following characters are played by people who have made at least one album. Which one is not?
questions.explanation:
Carmela Soprano.

	Jamie-Lynn Sigler (Meadow) released her first album, 'Here To Heaven,' in 2001. In the same year, Dominic Chianese (Uncle Junior) released his first album, 'Hits.' Silvio Dante is played by 'Little' Steven Van Zandt, who was (and remains!) a member of Bruce Springsteen's E Street Band, and who has released a number of albums on his own with his band, The Imperials. Edie Falco (Carmela) has yet to venture into the professional music business.

questions.text: What is the actual last name of Paulie Walnuts?
questions.explanation:
Gaultieri.

	It's not mentioned often, but every now and then someone refers to him as Paulie Gaultieri. Jimmy Altieri was a capo later revealed to be a rat; La Cerva is the last name of Christopher's fiancee, Adriana.

questions.text: Tony's high school buddy David Scatino, a compulsive gambler, got in way over his head with Tony's crew, who subsequently took over and eventually bankrupted his place of business. What was it?
questions.explanation:
A sporting goods store.

	Scatino is played by Robert Patrick, perhaps best known as the 'liquid metal' T-1000 in 'Terminator 2: Judgment Day.'

questions.text: In the third season, Ralphie Ciffaretto's long-standing affair with an exotic dancer comes to a tragic end. What was her name?
questions.explanation:
Tracee.

	Tracy's final, brutal moments alive are difficult to watch.

questions.text: Tony's old pal Artie Bucco owns a restaurant where many meals are enjoyed by the characters. What's it called?
questions.explanation:
Vesuvio & Vesuvio 2 & Vesuvio II.

	Tony and his crew were responsible for burning down the original Vesuvio, but Artie was able to rebuild an even better 'reborn' Vesuvio with the insurance money.

questions.text: Uncle Junior's right-hand man, Bobby Bacala, Jr., is the son of a once-famous hitman. Bobby, Sr. makes an appearance in the third season. What veteran actor plays him?
questions.explanation:
Burt Young.

	Burt Young (Paulie from the 'Rocky' movies) plays Bacala's father.

questions.text: It seems as though most of the male characters on the show are extremely attracted to Christopher's fiancee Adriana...but which of the following men has actually admitted to being in love with her?
questions.explanation:
Artie Bucco.

	Artie, miserable in his marriage, has long held a torch for Adriana, who worked as a hostess in his restaurant. He finally told her of his feelings for her in the third season, but he was quickly rebuffed.

questions.text: Tony takes up with a new mistress in the third season, a car salesperson named Gloria Trillo. What kind of cars does Gloria sell for a living?
questions.explanation:
Mercedes.

	Gloria (Annabella Sciorra) went on to commit suicide in the fourth season.

questions.text: Dr. Jennifer Melfi has a son who is in college. What's his name?
questions.explanation:
Jason.

	We only see Jason about once a season.

questions.text: The wife of which character is played by the real-life wife of the actor playing him?
questions.explanation:
Silvio Dante.

	Maureen Van Zandt, the real-life wife of 'Little' Steven Van Zandt, plays Silvio Dante's wife, Gabriella.

questions.text: In the first season, Tony meets -- and finds himself very attracted to -- a beautiful young Italian housesitter. What's her name?
questions.explanation:
Isabella.

	The episode is named for her, actually...even though she was just a figment of Tony's imagination!

questions.text: Uncle Junior learns in the third season that he has a serious disease. What is it?
questions.explanation:
Cancer.

	Junior refers to cancer as 'the big casino.'
